name: Key Glock
description: '''Markeyvius LaShun Cathey''' (born August 3, 1997), known professionally as '''Key Glock''', is an American rapper, songwriter, and record producer. The cousin of late  Memphis rapper [[Young Dolph]], Cathey signed with his record label, Paper Route Empire, to release his commercial mixtape, ''Glock Season'' (2017). His debut studio album, ''[[Yellow Tape (Key Glock album)|Yellow Tape]]'' (2020), peaked at number 14 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and received [[RIAA certification|gold]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). His second album, ''[[Yellow Tape 2]]'' (2021), peaked at number seven on the chart and spawned the [[RIAA certification|multi-platinum]]-certified single "[[Ambition for Cash]]", as well as "[[Proud (Key Glock song)|Proud]]", which was released in the wake of Dolph's death and marked his first entry on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. His third album, ''[[Glockoma 2]]'' (2023), spawned the sleeper hit single "[[Let's Go (Key Glock song)|Let's Go]]"â€”his second entry on the chart.
